item.title: Germany Avoids Recession, But GDP Undershoots Forecasts
item.description: Germany’s GDP flatlined from April to June compared with economy avoiding a recession, as household consumption stabilized after contracting in the winter.

item.title: Taiwan's Economy Recovered in Second Quarter
item.description: Taiwan’s economy rose 1.45% in the second quarter, recovering from two consecutive quarters of economic contraction.

item.title: AstraZeneca Looks Set to Sustain Longer-Term Growth After 2Q Beat
item.description: AstraZeneca shares rose almost 4% after its second-quarter results showed revenue and EPS ahead of market views, with the underlying business delivering strong growth, Shore Capital said.

item.title: Copper Set for Weekly Rise on China Stimulus Hopes
item.description: Copper prices were firmer and on course for a weekly gain as expectations of Chinese stimulus have overcome fears about the nation’s metals demand.

item.title: Oil Price Edges Higher as US Economy Looks Resilient
item.description: Oil futures remained on course for a fifth consecutive weekly increase, with strong U.S. economic data on Thursday the latest factor giving prices a boost.

item.title: Data-Dependency Could Favor Dollar Over Euro
item.description: With both the Fed and the ECB saying that future rate decisions will depend on upcoming economic data, the short-term outlook for the dollar looks more favorable than the euro, Commerzbank said.

item.title: Ten-Year BTP-Bund Spread Seen at Attractive Level in 2H
item.description: The 10-year Italian BTP-German Bund yield spread is expected to remain at attractive levels, Societe Generale said, as domestic investors are still buying and it doesn’t foresee political tensions to emerge.

item.title: Sanofi Upgrades Outlook After Earnings Beat
item.description: Sanofi raised its 2023 EPS guidance after it reported second-quarter adjusted earnings that beat analysts’ expectations and despite sales falling short of estimates.

item.title: AstraZeneca Core EPS Rises 25%; Maintains Revenue Outlook
item.description: AstraZeneca said its second-quarter core earnings per share rose to $2.15, and reiterated its 2023 forceast for revenue to increase by a low-to-mid single-digit percentage.

item.title: Casino Strikes Debt Deal With Kretinsky-Led Consortium
item.description: Casino has reached an agreement in principle with a consortium led by Daniel Kretinsky to shore up its capital base and restructure its debt, but would see shareholder value “massively diluted.”

item.title: Bank of Japan Hints It Will Accept Higher Rates, Lifting Bond Yields
item.description: The central bank calls cap on government bond yields a reference point, not a rigid limit.

item.title: NatWest Second Quarter Tops Hopes But Trims Guidance
item.description: NatWest posted an operating pretax profit of £1.8 billion for the second quarter and announced a £500 million share buyback, but lowered its net interest margin guidance for 2023.

item.title: Hermes Earnings Jump on Strong Asia Growth
item.description: Hermes said recurring operating income grew 28% in the first half to almost €3 billion, helped by the rebound of wholesale and in-store sales in Asia, and the company backed its medium-term goal for revenue growth at constant exchange rates.

item.title: IAG Profit Beats Forecasts, Sees Strong Outlook
item.description: IAG reported a sharply-higher adjusted operating profit of €1.3 billion and said its outlook for summer was encouraging, with around 80% of its expected revenue already booked, while full-year capacity was seen around 97% of pre-Covid-19 levels.

item.title: Eni Outlook on Track Despite Profit Slide
item.description: Eni said its adjusted operating profit fell to €3.4 billion in the second quarter on sales that dropped 38%, as weaker market prices took their toll, but the company maintained its full-year production and profit targets while trimming its outlook for cashflow.

item.title: OMV Profits Hit by Lower Prices
item.description: OMV posted a 67% drop in adjusted net profit in the second quarter after market prices fell from record-high levels, and for the year, it forecast an average Brent price of $75-$80 and an average realized gas price of around EUR30.

item.title: Clariant Keeps Outlook After Weaker Secoind Quarter
item.description: Clariant reported weaker second-quarter earnings of CHF175 million and warned that it didn’t expect a substantial economic recovery in the second half, confirming its recently-updated sales and Ebitda targets for 2023.

item.title: Air France-KLM Tops Forecasts, Sees Strong Demand
item.description: Air France-KLM confirmed its capacity forecast for the year after it reported second-quarter results well ahead of analysts’ expectations, with operating profit rising 90% to €733 million.

item.title: Vinci Posts Higher Profit, Strong Order Growth
item.description: Vinci reported a higher net profit of €2.1 billion in the first half on a 14% rise in sales and said it had positive cash flow and an order book of €61.5 billion.

item.title: Capgemini Maintains Outlook as Profits Rise 8%
item.description: Capgemini posted an operating profit of €1.2 billion in the first half and confirmed its full-year growth targets but acknowledged that the more challenging macro-economic environment led to a slowdown in line with its expectations.
